metadata.title: CVE-2017-9083 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
poppler 0.54.0, as used in Evince and other products, has a NULL pointerdereference in the JPXStream::readUByte function in JPXStream.cc. Forexample, the perf_test utility will crash (segmentation fault) when parsingan invalid PDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9083` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.48.0-2ubuntu3
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.48.0-2ubuntu3
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.48.0-2ubuntu3
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.48.0-2ubuntu3
libpoppler73 - 0.48.0-2ubuntu3
poppler-utils - 0.48.0-2ubuntu3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: poppler package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.48.0-2ubuntu3').
